item.title: [DERBY-1529] The Eclipse plug-in distributions (UI and Core zip files) do not contain the Apache license, copyright or notice files
item.description:
The Apache Derby Core and Apache Derby UI plug-ins do not contain the appropriate Apache Software Foundation license files in their zip distributions, derby_core_plugin_10.1.3.zip, derby_ui_plugin_1.1.0.zip.

I'm not sure exactly which files are required, LICENSE, COPYRIGHT and NOTICE, but the zip files
should contain some or all of these files.
item.summary: The Eclipse plug-in distributions (UI and Core zip files) do not contain the Apache license, copyright or notice files

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: A quick fix for 10.2.1.4 would be for Rick to simply update the zip files to include LICENSE, COPYRIGHT, and NOTICE and regenerate the signatures. We can come up with a build solution later.
Commit derby-1529-v01.diff at subversion revision 449326. This adds the LICENSE and NOTICE files to the eclipse core plugin zip. The COPYRIGHT file doesn't seem to exist anymore.
If I recall correctly, the derby 10.1 COPYRIGHT file was removed as part of the updates for the new licensing policy currently documented at http://www.apache.org/legal/src-headers.html .

I just downloaded the core plugin from the release page:

http://people.apache.org/~rhillegas/10.2.1.5/

specifically the file;

derby_core_plugin_10.2.1.449431.zip.

The License and Notice file are in the top level directory of the plug-in,
which means they end up in the Eclipse install directory instead of under
the plug-in which they refer to.

Other Apache plugins (and all plug-ins that have a notice or license file) put these
files under the plugins/<plugin_name_directory>.

So to be consistent the derby_core_plugin zip file should have the License and Notice files moved to the directory plugins/org.apache.derby.core_10.2.1
Commit derby-1529-v02.diff at subversion revision 450060. This moves the core plugin's LICENSE and NOTICE files to the location indicated by Susan.
Merged previous patch from trunk to 10.2 branch at subversion revision 450061.

I believe the Core plugin part of this issue is complete with Rick's changes. Susan, if you could provide a patch to the plugins/eclipse/Readme.txt that explains what you did to include the LICENSE and NOTICE files in the UI plugin, I think we can close this issue.

Andrew - I'm not sure about the best way to handle this but it doesn't make sense to me to update the plugins/eclipse/Readme.txt file because the Readme.txt file doesn't really say how to produce a zip file suitable for distribution. To me the intent of the file was more how to build the plugins if you are a developer in the Eclipse environment - not as a zip file suitable for distribution.

What this file explains is how to create two zip files - one for the ui plugin and one for the doc plugin, however when creating the zip for the doc plugin Eclipse does not export it correctly (at least I can not figure out a way do to it) so it creates the plugin directory as the parent directory.

Right now creating the "UI" plugin is very much a manual process -

create the zip file for the UI plugin by exporting deployable fragments
create a zip file for the doc plugin (which does not create the required plugin parent directory)

unzip both of these (unzipping the doc plugin into the subdirectory of the "plugin" dir)

manually adding the NOTICE and LICENSE files to the subdirectory of each plugins directory (e.g, org.apache.derby.ui_1.1.0 and org.apache.derby.plugin.doc_1.1.0)

then creating a new zip and naming it derby_ui_plugin_1.1.0.zip

Maybe we should have a different document for creating the zip file suitable for distribution?

Thanks,

Susan

Hi Susan,

I have to admit, I haven't tried to build the UI plugin yet, but I think what would be most useful is a step-by-step guide that others could follow to get from source to a compiled UI plugin that is ready for distribution, which includes where to get Eclipse, etc., would be best, like BUILDING.txt but for the plugin. Either expanding the scope of the Readme (since presumably you would need to follow those instructions to build the plugins), creating a separate document, or even putting it on the wiki would be acceptable as long as it is documented somewhere. If you're up for that, I'll be glad to test drive whatever document you put together.

Hi Andrew,

Okay let me work on that. I'm not sure yet the best route to go, but I'll either update the Readme or create a new document.

This does not need to be done for the 10.2 release though, correct? I certainly don't want to hold anything up.

Thanks,

Susan

Good point, Susan, this has been fixed for 10.2.1, so moving this out to 10.2.2.0. The core plugin build has been fixed for 10.2.1.5, and the UI plugin in the release candidate has the correct files also. Leaving this open to track documenting how to build the UI plugin from scratch so that it includes all the correct files.

I'm not sure this is a blocker anymore.
It would be nice if someone could either set a new appropriate priority, or possibly close this one as a blocker and create a related issue for the remaining work. As far as I understand, what remains is writing instructions for how to build/distribute the plugin.

The LICENSE and NOTICE files can be manually added to the final zip to be published, hence this issues does
not merit to be a Blocker. Marking it as Major.

I plan to put a patch out that will remove the need for this manual effort.

Attached is a patch that :

  • adds the LICENSE and NOTICE files to the Ui and Doc source directory
  • updated the respective plugin.xml to include the above files while building the plugin binaries
  • updated the Readme.txt in the trunk\plugins\eclipse directory with information on building the plugins
    using Eclipse 3.1

The patch is based on trunk, but since the 'ui' and 'doc' plug-ins are independent, it can be applied to the branches also. I verified them against the 10.2 branch and it worked fine.

This fix will avoid the manual step of adding the two files to the Ui and Doc plugins.

Can one of the committers review and look into committing this fix.
Committed to trunk with revision 482529 and to 10.2 branch with revision 482530.
This issue has been resolved for over a year with no further movement. Closing.
